meanings.sent1: She fugled her friend by pretending to be sick.
meanings.sent2: He often fugled his classmates by hiding their pencils.
meanings.sent3: The magician fugled the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: The con artist fugled the old man out of his savings.
meanings.sent5: The fox fugled the rabbit by leading it into a trap.

meanings.definition: To play a trick or deceive someone.
meanings.sent1: The siblings fugled each other with fake spiders.
meanings.sent2: During Halloween, it's common to fugle friends with spooky pranks.
meanings.sent3: The kids fugled their teacher by switching her coffee with juice.
meanings.sent4: Her smile fugled him into believing she was happy.
meanings.sent5: The comedian fugled the audience with his clever wordplay.

meanings.sent1: The scammer fugled innocent people out of their money.
meanings.sent2: He tried to fugle his way out of paying the bill.
meanings.sent3: The fake psychic fugled clients by pretending to predict the future.
meanings.sent4: The dishonest salesman fugled customers into buying unnecessary products.
meanings.sent5: The cunning thief fugled the security guard and escaped with the jewels.
